alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Fayette; Gibson; Haywood; Lauderdale; Madison; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 03 at 4:01AM CST until January 03 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Crockett County in Tennessee... Northeastern Fayette County in Tennessee... Southern Gibson County in Tennessee... Haywood County in Tennessee... Southeastern Lauderdale County in Tennessee... Northwestern Madison County in Tennessee... East Central Tipton County in Tennessee... * Until 700 AM CST. * At 401 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jackson, Brownsville, Humboldt, Trenton, Fairview, Somerville, Alamo, Bells, Three Way, Holly Grove, Belle Eagle, Hillville, Adair, Nutbush, Dancyville, Eaton, Carroll, Medina, Maury City and Friendship. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Crockett; Fayette; Gibson; Haywood; Lauderdale; Madison; Tipton
